definition: thin or slender/finely particulate/thin and soft/fine/delicate/trifling/(of a sound) quiet/frugal

sentences.english: Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed and some few to be chewed and digested.
sentences.chinese: 書有可淺嘗者，有可吞食者，少數則須細嚼慢嚥。

sentences.english: Eating at the table can make you slow down and be more mindful of whatyou’re eating.
sentences.chinese: 在餐桌上喫早餐能使你慢下來，更能細嚼慢嚥。

sentences.english: Candice:According to my own experience, eating slowly is better.
sentences.chinese: 喫飯還是細嚼慢嚥比較好，這是我的經驗談。

sentences.english: One thing that works well to slow down when eating is to put down the fork between bites.
sentences.chinese: 想要細嚼慢嚥的話，咀嚼時放下刀叉是個不錯的方法。

sentences.english: Eating slowly will help ensure that you can hear your body’s satiation signals.
sentences.chinese: 細嚼慢嚥能讓你注意到身體所發出的飽感信號。

sentences.english: Ingesting food should be unhurried, moderate, careful in the chewing and slow in swallowing.
sentences.chinese: 進食時應該從容緩和，專心致志，細嚼慢嚥。

sentences.english: Be sure you eat it slowly, savoring every bite.
sentences.chinese: 一定要慢慢地喫，每口都細嚼慢嚥。

definition: dilettante/amateur/to dabble in/to flirt with (a topic)
hot pot containing stinky tofu and other ingredients (Taiwanese dish)
